briefdescription.para: If the layer is identifiable using the identify map tool and as a WMS layer.
If the layer can be removed from the project. The layer will not be removable from the legend menu entry but can still be removed with an API call.
Only for vector-layer, determines if the layer is used in the 'search all layers' locator.
Flags for the map layer.

simplesect.para: Flags are options specified by the user used for the UI but are not preventing any API call.

briefdescription.para: Added in 3.2.
Types of layers that can be added to a map.
Maplayer has a style and a metadata property.
General configuration: identifiable, removable, searchable, display expression, read-only.
Symbology.
3D symbology
Labeling.
Aliases, widgets, WMS/WFS, expressions, constraints, virtual fields.
Feature form.
Actions.
Map tips.
Diagrams.
Attribute table settings: choice and order of columns, conditional styling.
Rendering: scale visibility, simplify method, opacity.
Custom properties (by plugins for instance)
Geometry validation configuration.

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum map scale (i.e.

most "zoomed in" scale) at which the layer will be visible. The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map. A scale of 0 indicates no maximum scale visibility.

layerElement
The DOM element corresponding to ``maplayer'' tag
context
writing context (e.g. for conversion between relative and absolute paths)
The DOM node corresponds to a DOM document project file XML element read by QgsProject.
This, in turn, calls readXml() (and then readSymbology()), which is overridable by sub-classes so that they can read their own specific state from the given DOM node.
Invoked by QgsProject::read().

briefdescription.para: Sets whether auto refresh is enabled for the layer.
Sets the auto refresh interval (in milliseconds) for the layer.

detaileddescription.para: This will cause the layer to be automatically redrawn on a matching interval. Note that auto refresh must be enabled by calling setAutoRefreshEnabled().

Note that auto refresh triggers deferred repaints of the layer. Any map canvas must be refreshed separately in order to view the refreshed layer.
autoRefreshInterval()
setAutoRefreshEnabled()

The DOM node corresponds to a DOM document project file XML element to be written by QgsProject.
This, in turn, calls writeXml() (and then writeSymbology), which is over-rideable by sub-classes so that they can write their own specific state to the given DOM node.
Invoked by QgsProject::write().

briefdescription.para: Set the notification message that triggers repaine If refresh on notification is enabled, the notification will triggerRepaint only if the notification message is equal to.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to enable scale based visibility

briefdescription.para: Will advise the map canvas (and any other interested party) that this layer requires to be repainted.

detaileddescription.para: Will emit a repaintRequested() signal. If deferredUpdate is true then the layer will only be repainted when the canvas is next re-rendered, and will not trigger any canvas redraws itself.

simplesect.para: in 2.6 function moved from vector/raster subclasses to QgsMapLayer

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the auto refresh interval changes.
Signal emitted when the blend mode is changed, through QgsMapLayer::setBlendMode()
Emitted whenever the configuration is changed.

detaileddescription.para: The project listens to this signal to be marked as dirty.

briefdescription.para: Emit a signal that layer's CRS has been reset.
Data of layer changed.
Emitted whenever the layer's data source has been changed.
Emitted when dependencies are changed.
Emitted when layer's flags have been modified.
Signal emitted when legend of the layer has changed.
Emitted when the layer's metadata is changed.
Emitted when the name has been changed.
This is used to send a request that any mapcanvas using this layer update its extents.
Signal emitted when 3D renderer associated with the layer has changed.
Signal emitted when renderer is changed.
By emitting this signal the layer tells that either appearance or content have been changed and any view showing the rendered layer should refresh itself.

detaileddescription.para: If deferredUpdate is true then the layer will only be repainted when the canvas is next re-rendered, and will not trigger any canvas redraws itself.

briefdescription.para: Emit a signal with status (e.g. to be caught by QgisApp and display a msg on status bar)
Signal emitted whenever a change affects the layer's style.

detaileddescription.para:
Ie this may be triggered by renderer changes, label style changes, or other style changes such as blend mode or layer opacity changes.
rendererChanged()
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: Emitted in the destructor when the layer is about to be deleted, but it is still in a perfectly valid state: the last chance for other pieces of code for some cleanup if they use the layer.
Add error message.
Copies attributes like name, short name, ...

detaileddescription.para:
into another layer.
layer
The copy recipient
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Base class for all map layer types.

detaileddescription.para: This is the base class for all map layer types (vector, raster).
